values: My Gabie is a few days shy from her 22nd month but she's already a diva-in-the-making. She knows what she wants and knows how to get it. You'll get an earful if you don't give in or she'll say you're bad. Hmmm... I don't want her to grow up a brat.

I seem to be a bit lost, not literally of course. I've been multi-tasking on a lot of stuffs both at home and at work, that I seem to be wandering... Oh dear. One minute I'm a careerwoman and then a mom and wife. I get a bit restless when I fall into this maze that's in my head. Hay, I actually have so much to tell you about Gabriel but it's already 2am and my eyes are shutting close already. Next time na lang. ;)

It was a working day so I had to rush home to be able to be with my hubby and baby for dinner.  Hubby and I never celebrated the event, it has always been just another day for us but now that we're parents, it felt right to celebrate it somehow -- with flowers, teddy bears and chocolates -- just for our little girl.

Our house is just two blocks away from the famous Dangwa -- the flower haven in Manila -- so I dropped by and tried to look for a flower arrangement suitable for my girl.  I got her a bear, balloon and plush flower arrangement at a really ridiculous price -- peak season daw...  Anyway, I was excited to give it to her but to my surprise, I got my own wonderful and really big flower arrangement.  Hubby and Gabie also went to Dangwa for my surprise.  It was wonderful.

After I've settled in, changed clothes etc... we headed to Timog Ave for late dinner.  Gabie was so daldal in the restaurant.  Everybody near our table was pointing at the cute, little girl. :)

Here are some pictures:
<a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/jovyandchris/2280201977/" title="Picture 608 by jovy,chrisNgabie, on Flickr"><img src="http://farm3.static.flickr.com/2021/2280201977_829e4e768e_m.jpg" width="240" height="180" alt="Picture 608" /></a> <a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/jovyandchris/2280992980/" title="Picture 617 by jovy,chrisNgabie, on Flickr"><img src="http://farm3.static.flickr.com/2105/2280992980_f9248386bc_m.jpg" width="240" height="180" alt="Picture 617" /></a>
<a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/jovyandchris/2280202575/" title="Picture 620 by jovy,chrisNgabie, on Flickr"><img src="http://farm4.static.flickr.com/3050/2280202575_41f79da547_m.jpg" width="240" height="180" alt="Picture 620" /></a> <a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/jovyandchris/2280993588/" title="Picture 624 by jovy,chrisNgabie, on Flickr"><img src="http://farm4.static.flickr.com/3151/2280993588_e622956f9b_m.jpg" width="240" height="180" alt="Picture 624" /></a>

It's been two weeks since I've started working.  First of all, let me just thank God for this blessing.  It's been wonderful.  I really enjoy the job and the company of new co-worker bees. :)
I don't feel like the new person and they never made me feel like the newbie, anyway.

It's also been two weeks since I've started leaving Gabie with her dad.  We're having difficulties getting a nanny but we've got househelp to do the laundry/ironing/cleaning.  But hubby totally surprised me and exceeded my expectations of him as a dad, he's just so great with Gabie.  He didn't take the responsibility as a task but bonding time with our daughter.  Now, Gabie prefers to be with him.  I guess, he's more fun to be with than me.  I'm not her playmate but the two of them together is just wonderful to my eyes.  I'm loving the father of my child even more each day. I'm so thankful that I have him as a partner and bestfriend.

One thing that they regularly do to make me feel part of their playtime is to video call me every afternoon.  Once our Internet service is installed, the web cam will be a great tool for us.  Don't you just love technology?  It shortens distances.  A loved one is just one gadget away.

It's official! I'm going back to work :) It's been a year now since I stopped working and concentrated on motherhood.  Well, Gabie is now 8 months old and has successfully taken the bottle without any problems.  She's also eating solids now so while I'm away at work, she'll be fine (crossing my fingers). 

I haven't confirmed my start date at the office yet, but I have started working on a project which I'm doing at home.  Technology is my partner -- a laptop, broadband Internet, and mobile phone. I don't have to be away from my Gabriel so much.

So when did I start jobhunting, you ask?  Well, I didn't really find it.  It found me.  I got a call from a former boss and a dear friend on my birthday and he mentioned that his friends are looking for somebody who can handle web projects and had experience on e-commerce site management.  I got excited and very interested.  Four weeks later, I received a job offer which I accepted.  The "interview" that I had with the CEO, COO, Business Dev't head and HR Manager was at least 3.5 hours and it was the most enjoyable job interview that I've ever had (not that I had a lot).

Anyway, I'll be back to earning my own money and doing other things than diaper changing, breastfeeding and being mommy.

It's so difficult to get a nanny these days.  It's even more difficult when the mommy (that's me) has so many requirements -- at least a high school graduate, with no distinct local accent, married with at least 1 child and many more... tsk! tsk! tsk!  

No one can blame me! I've taken cared of my precious daughter from the moment she was born.  I hardly asked for anybody else's help in the 8 months that Gabie has been with us.  Now, I'm in a bind.  I don't want to leave her with just anybody.  If I had a choice, I would have picked my (and my siblings') nanny, Nanay Mary, who's been with our family for 27 years and counting.  However, she's taking care of my nephew Jed and my younger siblings who are staying in Manila.  I know that I can leave Gabie with her and I wouldn't have to worry at all.  Oh well...

I was offline for a few days 'cause my PC crashed!  There was no warning or any hint that something was amiss.  I just tried to turn it on and it kept hanging on initial startup and after three forced shutdowns and restarts, the dreaded Windows message just showed on the black screen:

Windows could not start because the following file is missing or corrupt:  \Windows\System32\Config\System
You can attempt to repair this file by starting Windows Setup using the original Setup CD-ROM. Select 'r' tat the first screen to start repair.

The thing is, my laptop did not come with a Windows XP Home Edition CD.  Acer has pre-bundled it within the eRecovery application.  I normally use it to restore to factory settings whenever I needed to do so but not when the OS is corrupted.  I'm just thankful that Acer Singapore's e-mail support team is very reliable.

It's now working sans battery pack which apparently causes my laptop to go bonkers.  I'm using direct AC power, though.  The most heartbreaking part is not the actual crash but restoring it to factory settings meaning deleting ALL data.  All my Gabie's pictures are gone!  I have no other backup but on my iPhone which is currently a one-way process (pc via iTunes to iPhone) unless I purchase a 3rd party software... Bummer.

If I have 100K dispensible money, I'll buy myself an Apple computer, unless somebody generously donates one to me. Haha!

The day after Christmas, Gabie got sick. After her night feeding, she started vomiting so much that I, myself, began shaking out of fear for her. It was a mother's nightmare. She had no control over it and despite her cries, she kept on going. It's like her tummy had a mind of its own. It was hell.

Throughout the night, she kept vomiting at least every 20 minutes. I tried to re-feed her with milk or even water but she kept throwing it all out. I called my aunt, who's also her pediatrician and we were advised to give her Pedialyte 45 and Plasyl to rehydrate immediately. Jovy rushed to the nearest pharmacy and we medicated her as quickly as we could. She hardly slept through the night. I stayed up myself. I was scared for my little girl. She looked really helpless and vulnerable. The glow in her eyes was gone.

The next day, when no signs of improvement were visible, we rushed her to the hospital. She already had high fever and started with LBM. She's dehydrated and there was no choice but to put an IV bag on her. At the ER, Jovy left me at her bedside because he didn't want to hear her cry out in pain when the IV is inserted in her vein. I had no choice but to be the stronger parent but inside, I was shaking and scared. I almost threw up at the nurse because I got dizzy with the smell of the hospital and fear. Luckily, the nurse was good to successfully put her IV with just one try. We were at the hospital for three days and family and friends were there to show concern to our little girl.

She's doing better. After 6 dextrose bags, color has returned on her skin. No longer pale, quiet and in pain, we can now hear her giggle once in a while.

Thank God that we didn't have to spend the new year there. She still has a mild case of lbm but better. Her kuya Jed said that Gabie's better now. She will be.

May the new year bring her better health and no more worries for us. Hay.... what an experience.

A week ago, I posted that hubby gave me an early birthday gift.  I have been using it for a week now and I'm loving it more each day.  Thanks to the available resources online, I managed to make it fully-functional.  Yup, the iPod feature is now working and I've synced photos, videos, songs and audiobooks.  I have about 700MB left out of the 8GB available. Haha.

I only have one problem with it: SMS, particularly the keyboard!  Whenever I send an SMS, I have to make sure that I read the message before sending it because some of the words get changed.  I hate the autocompletion/autocorrection feature.

Right now, I can't forward messages because of the 'conversation thread' interface, more like chat.  However, there are applications available that could give me this feature.  For now, I'm okay with it. 

Hubby wants one for himself but I told him that his current phone's features are still better.  Mine is just prettier, although, he can wait for the 3G version that may come out in 2008.

The entire family found out that our bunso has a girlfriend.  Our dad threw a fit.  He got really mad because a few hours before my sister spilled the beans, he asked my brother if he already has a girlfriend.  He said he's got none.  If there's one thing that our dad hates, it's lying to his face.  Because he got busted, he's now grounded and his cellphone got confiscated as well.  Poor boy, had he admitted the truth I don't think all this fuss would have happened.  Our dad has pretty much tamed down compared to when my sisters and I were young. The little ones (well, they're not so little anymore) got lucky with our dad's kind of discipline.

Anyway, our little boy got really upset because he felt that we were all ganging up on him.  I, honestly, do not want him to have a girlfriend at this time in his life.  He just turned 13 in May, for pete's sake!  I'm worried that he'd lose his focus on his studies and go astray.  He is such a smart boy and charming at that.  He's new in school, recently transferred from the province.  I'm worried that his new set of friends would not be good influences on him. Kids nowadays are different to when my generation was in high school.  Girls are more open to early relationships, premarital sex and my goodness, I don't want him to make a mistake and make me an aunt.  I would hate the girl forever!!! I swear, I will. 

I envision such a good future for my younger siblings.  I see big things happening in their lives.  My youngest sister is now a certified public accountant and I'm so darn proud of her.  I want our younger siblings to have the same bright future!

So okay, I admit that what we did was an overkill, but how else do you convince a young boy to break up with somebody he thinks he loves?  Our mom asked him a number of times if he loves the girl and he neither said yes or no, which worried me all the more. We all freaked out, yes, but we love him and we only want what's best for him even if he thinks that we're being selfish.  He may hate us now but he'll realize that we don't want him to go astray.  I don't want my parents' sacrifices to be for nothing.  He's young, he'll have plenty of girls to love but not now.  He has to remain focused on his end goal -- a good education at least. 

Our dad said that he doesn't mind if he won't finish school but who wants to be the great disappointment in the family?  I'm sure that he wouldn't want to be the child who ruined his future.  Sure, we're over-reacting... we're still his family and he can't get rid of us.

I really don't care if the girl gets heartbroken. She told my brother 'sasagutin na kita para di ka na mahirapan' or something like that within a week!  Hello!  Okay, so I'm judgmental.  Fine!  All big sisters are like that.

Since I've given birth, I've wanted to have some "me" time and I did...today!

For a few hours, I got myself pampered at the salon.  Jovy and Gabie went around the mall for some daddy and baby bonding while mommy gets treated like a princess. Hee.

I got my nails done.  Had my hair cut a little short and treated as well (hair spa!).  Had my head, back and foot massaged. Sarap!  I didn't even care what kind of haircut they were giving me.  I was just enjoying all the hands fussing over me. I was texting with friends, listening to Snow Patrol in my iPhone and reading Marie Claire.  I was happy.

There were moments that I missed Gabie and wondered if she was looking for me but hubby said that they were okay.  Although, he did drop by the salon and asked me to change Gabie's nappy which I happily did.  I was in a good mood.  I was my talkative self and bragging my little girl's pictures.

Hay, ang sarap! I swear I will ask for another day off! :)

***

My iPhone is now fully functional.  Thanks to all the available references in the WWWeb.  I can't wait to customize it.  Hubby wants to sell his n95 and get his very own iPhone.  I told him that it still has better features and we can swap phones once in a while. Ahh, I love technology...

My phone, a Nokia n93i, had been giving me headaches for a long time.  It completely shuts down for no reason and I wouldn't know that it died on me unless I check for messages.  I've been pretty much cooped up in the house and getting SMS is my only connection to family and friends.

I've been asking hubby to get it fixed since it's still under warranty from Nokia Care.  However, instead of getting it fixed, he bought me a new phone.  It's so pretty and I love it. 

I haven't taken its picture yet, but here's how it looks (taken off the web):











I'm going to call her Mac, haha, not very original but I think it's a cute name for my new gadget.  It's been a while since I've had a new toy and this is just the perfect birthday/Christmas gift.  I couldn't ask for anything else, materially speaking that is. :)

It works using my Globe SIM but I've yet to use it's iPod function or customize it.  Anyone who has any idea how to make it work with iTunes or at least transfer files between this device and a PC, please drop me a note.  I need help but I'm loving the phone so much, I can forget about some disappointments.

From left to right: (top) Lourdes and kid, Emily, Joanne, Genevieve, Tanya and kid; (sitting) Jhoan, Christian and Gabie, Cynthia, Jennifer, Charisse, Carmel Anne, Miraflor, Eunice, Jojie, Charlotte, Lilibeth and kid *** Last Friday (Nov 9), I met up with some of my high school batch mates for a mini-reunion at Fontana Villas and Leisure Park. I received a Friendster message from Cynthia, one of the organizers. I asked hubby if he'd let me attend and if he'd like to join. He was okay with it since he knows that I've been pretty much cooped up here in the house. Plus, there was no other choice but to go with me because Gabie will definitely be with me. Anyway, we were there at 4PM and there were only a couple of people around but by 6PM, you can't drop a needle in the villa. Happy shrieks everywhere. Old friends seeing each other again, after so many years. It was fun watching from the sidelines. I just listened mostly to chikahan and enjoyed the company of old, familiar faces. We may have aged in number but I don't think anybody changed -- in weight, maybe. Haha. Like me, some brought their kids and I'm not talking about toddlers but school-aged girls. Some have kids as old as 10 but there's one who joined us in all her pregnant glory. Hubby and I got teased because we were high school sweethearts. They were talking about crushes and asked who my love team was in school and I said that I only had one and I married him. Hehe. I even kidded that they jinxed me from having a baby because of the "chismis" that spread false information of my pregnancy. Anyway, it was an overnight get-together but we (my family) left at around 10PM. The rest stayed for more chikahan, booze and picture-taking! Hopefully, we can do this again and there will be more people joining us. More photos here!

Fisher-Price Recalls Licensed Character Toys Due To Lead Poisoning Hazard
Source: http://www.cpsc.gov/cpscpub/prerel/prhtml07/07257.html


Early this month, Fisher-Price has announced its recall of more than 900,000 of its Dora the Explorer, Sesame Street et al toys.  I've bought my daughter a couple of Dora the Explorer toys and when I heard about the recall, I immediately checked the product codes to see if what we have are in the safe list or recalled list.  They're safe , whew!  But I still got worried 'cause most toys now (if not all) are all "Made in China".  How would parents, especially new parents like me, have the peace of mind that the toys they buy, or the toys that their kids receive as gifts, are safe? I checked all the toys that my Gabie had been exposed to and the rest that are still in storage.  Most are Made in China products.  Gabie will never play with some of them.  

***

Most of you know that I'm a breastfeeding mommy and recently Wyeth has also ordered a recall on some of their baby formulas.  Thank God, I didn't have to worry about this issue but my sister-in-law did.  She's no longer feeding her daughter with Promil Gold.  Why take the risk in continuing with the product even if the lot that she's got on stock aren't affected, would you?

On the eve of the release date of J.K. Rowling's last Harry Potter book, I got depressed. I wasn't able to reserve myself a copy of the book. I planned to but I couldn't get myself to justifying a P1300 spending on a book now that I'm a mother. On July 21, I avoided the news whether on TV or the Internet. I didn't want to see the hysteria over Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows. But of course, I lost the battle. Every channel (local or cable) covered it and so my inggit came to an all-time high. I was restless the whole day. I even went to search for torrent files particularly on the audiobook version. I found the files but I couldn't be satisfied. I want THE BOOK. I want to smell the ink on new paper. Feel the pages as I turn them. Stop and put it down when I want to give myself a good cry over a wonderful chapter or hasten my reading when I can't wait for the next page. In the previous books, I intentionally did not sleep until I was done reading. I welcomed my insomnia. On the day after (July 22), I asked hubby to buy me a copy. I think I kind of begged. I saw a copy of the book which my sis-in-law borrowed from her friend. I was jumping in frustration. I didn't know that I would feel this way over a book. Hubby didn't hesitate. He even asked me why I didn't order it in the first place. I told him that I didn't want to misspend money. He just gave me a weird look. Off we went to National Bookstore at SM Pampanga. I grabbed myself a copy while I was holding my baby and even whispered to her that someday she will read Harry Potter. At the cashier line, I got goosebumps while I waited for my turn to pay. My love for this series is so intense. What's weird, though, is the fact that I still haven't opened the book. The plastic cover is still intact. I dread to start reading and getting to the last page. It's hard to accept that this is the final book of the Harry Potter series. No more adventures and misadventures from Harry, Ron and Hermione but the magic goes on as the books get passed on. I'm going to make sure that my copies are going to be well-kept so when my Gabie is old enough to read, understand and enjoy the books, she can have them and she can experience the magic on her own.
